definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: The fortune of the young diplomat began to wane.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕外交官開始倒運了。
約翰可算是個倒運的預言家。

sentences.english: She hasn't been quite so unlucky as she pretends.
sentences.chinese: 她並不很像她所裝做的那樣倒運。

sentences.english: Nobody wants to have these bad things.
sentences.chinese: 誰也不想發作這些倒運透頂的事。

sentences.english: She hasn't been quite so unlucky as she pretends .
sentences.chinese: 她並不很像她所裝做的那樣倒運。

sentences.english: Some people think globalization is bad for small nations.
sentences.chinese: 有些人認爲全球化對小國倒運。

sentences.english: He had his ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 他有過自得之時，也有過倒運之日。
